unnormalised: When sending out invitations for events in India, especially weddings or large gatherings, remember to provide a complete address including the landmark! E.g., "Opp. Bandra Talao, Bandra West, Mumbai, MH, 400050" is much more helpful than just saying "Bandra Talao." Adding pin codes like 400001, 110001 are crucial for postmen and delivery services. If it's a banquet hall inside a hotel, include the hotel name and wing/floor, for example, "The Grand Ballroom, Taj Mahal Palace, Apollo Bunder, Colaba, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400001". Also, specify if the venue is near a metro station.
normalised: When sending out invitations for events in India, especially weddings or large gatherings, remember to provide a complete address including the landmark! For example, "Opposite Bandra Talao, Bandra West, Mumbai, M-H, four hundred thousand and fifty" is much more helpful than just saying "Bandra Talao." Adding pin codes like four hundred thousand and one, one hundred and ten thousand and one are crucial for postmen and delivery services. If it's a banquet hall inside a hotel, include the hotel name and wing slash floor, for example, "The Grand Ballroom, Taj Mahal Palace, Apollo Bunder, Colaba, Mumbai, Maharashtra four hundred thousand and one". Also, specify if the venue is near a metro station.
